intro: Onosma echioides var. densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered onosma, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers in dense clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
